title: Spaghetti Bolognese
description: Spaghetti Bolognese is a classic Italian pasta dish made with minced beef, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and herbs simmered into a rich meat sauce. It is typically served over spaghetti and topped with grated Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: Spaghetti: 400g;Ground Beef: 500g;Onion: 1 large, finely chopped;Garlic: 3 cloves, minced;Carrot: 1, finely diced;Celery: 1 stick, finely diced;Canned Tomatoes: 400g;Tomato Paste: 2 tbsp;Olive Oil: 2 tbsp;Salt: to taste;Black Pepper: to taste;Dried Oregano: 1 tsp;Bay Leaf: 1;Milk: 100ml;Grated Parmesan: for serving;Water: as needed
instructions:
Boil water in a large pot with a pinch of salt;Add spaghetti and cook until al dente according to package instructions;Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat;Add chopped onions and sauté for 3 to 4 minutes until soft.
Add garlic, carrots, and celery;Cook for another 4 to 5 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
Add ground beef to the pan;Cook and stir until browned evenly, breaking up lumps with a spoon.
Stir in tomato paste and mix thoroughly;Let it cook for 1 to 2 minutes to enhance flavor.
Pour in canned tomatoes and stir well;Add salt, black pepper, Italian herbs, and bay leaf if using.
Reduce heat to low;Simmer uncovered for 20 to 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sauce thickens.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed;Remove bay leaf before serving.
Serve sauce over cooked spaghetti;Top with grated Parmesan cheese.

title: Chicken Curry
description: Chicken Curry is a flavorful dish made by simmering chicken in a spiced gravy of onions, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, and a blend of aromatic spices. It's often enjoyed with rice or flatbread.
ingredients: Chicken (cut into pieces): 1kg; Curry Powder: 3 tbsp; Coconut Milk: 400ml; Onion (sliced): 2; Garlic (minced): 3 cloves; Ginger (grated): 1 inch piece; Cooking Oil: 2 tbsp; Water: 200ml (optional, for thinner gravy); Salt: to taste

title: Pancakes
description: Pancakes are thin, fluffy cakes made from a batter of flour, eggs, milk, and butter, cooked on a griddle. Theyre typically served with syrup, fruit, or whipped cream for breakfast or dessert.
ingredients: All-purpose flour: 1 cup;Milk: 1 cup;Egg: 1 large;Sugar: 2 tbsp;Baking powder: 2 tsp;Salt: 1/4 tsp;Butter (melted): 2 tbsp;Vanilla extract (optional): 1 tsp;Butter or oil (for cooking): as needed
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt;In another bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract;Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. The batter should be slightly lumpy but with no dry flour;Preheat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil;Pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan for each pancake. Let it spread naturally into a round shape;Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the edges look set. This usually takes 2 to 3 minutes;Flip the pancake gently and cook the other side until golden brown, about 1 to 2 minutes more;Remove from the pan and keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter;Serve pancakes warm with your favorite toppings such as maple syrup, fruits, or butter

title: Sushi Rolls
description: Sushi Rolls (Makizushi) are a popular Japanese dish consisting of vinegared rice, raw or cooked seafood, and vegetables wrapped in seaweed (nori). Theyre sliced into bite-sized pieces and often served with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
ingredients: Sushi Rice: 2 cups (uncooked);Water: 2¼ cups;Rice Vinegar: ¼ cup;Sugar: 2 tbsp;Salt: 1 tsp;Nori Sheets: 5;Cucumber: 1, julienned;Carrot: 1, julienned;Avocado: 1, sliced;Imitation Crab Sticks: 5 to 6;Soy Sauce: for serving;Wasabi: optional;Pickled Ginger: optional;Bamboo Sushi Mat: 1 (wrapped in plastic)

title: Chicken Teriyaki
description: Chicken Teriyaki features grilled or pan-fried chicken glazed in a sweet-savory sauce made from soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. It is usually served with steamed rice and vegetables.
ingredients: Chicken Thigh (boneless, skinless): 1kg;Soy Sauce: 150ml;Mirin (Japanese sweet rice wine): 100ml;Sugar: 3 tbsp;Garlic: 3 cloves, minced;Ginger: 1 inch, grated;Cornstarch: 1 tbsp;Water: 2 tbsp (for cornstarch slurry);Sesame Oil: 1 tbsp;Sesame Seeds: 1 tsp (optional garnish);Spring Onion: 1 stalk, chopped (optional garnish);Cooking Oil: 1 tbsp

title: Miso Soup
description: A comforting traditional miso-based soup. Broth-based soup with miso paste, tofu, and seaweed.
instructions: Bring water to a gentle boil in a medium saucepan; Add dashi powder and stir until dissolved; Reduce heat to low to keep the broth warm but not boiling; Place miso paste in a small bowl, add a few tablespoons of warm broth, and whisk until smooth; Slowly pour the miso mixture back into the saucepan while stirring gently; Add tofu cubes and dried wakame seaweed into the soup; Simmer for about 2-3 minutes, allowing the tofu to warm and wakame to rehydrate; Turn off the heat before the soup boils to preserve misos flavor; Ladle soup into bowls and sprinkle sliced green onions on top before serving.

title: Tempura
description: Japanese dish of seafood or vegetables lightly battered and deep-fried until crispy. It is served with a dipping sauce made of soy sauce, dashi, and mirin.

title: Tonkatsu
description: breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet popular in Japan. It is served with shredded cabbage and a tangy tonkatsu sauce.
ingredients: Pork loin chops: 4 (about 150-200g each);Salt: 1 tsp;Black pepper: 1/2 tsp;All-purpose flour: 1/2 cup;Eggs: 2, beaten;Panko breadcrumbs: 1 cup;Vegetable oil: for frying;Tonkatsu sauce: for serving;Shredded cabbage: for serving;Lemon wedges: optional
instructions: Pat pork chops dry and season both sides with salt and pepper;Prepare three shallow dishes: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with panko breadcrumbs;Dredge each pork chop in flour, shaking off excess;Dip into beaten eggs fully coating;Press into panko breadcrumbs firmly to cover evenly;Heat about 1 inch of vegetable oil in a deep pan over medium heat until it reaches 170-180°C (340-360°F);Carefully place the breaded pork chops in the hot oil without overcrowding;Fry each side for about 4-5 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through;Use tongs to turn gently and maintain even cooking;Remove chops and drain on paper towels;Slice tonkatsu into strips;Serve immediately with tonkatsu sauce drizzled on top, shredded cabbage, and lemon wedges if desired.

title: Ramen
description: Noodles in a rich, savory broth often flavored with soy or miso, and topped with meat, eggs, and vegetables.

title: Okonomiyaki
description: Savory Japanese pancake with various toppings like pork, shrimp, or cheese, drizzled with mayo and okonomiyaki sauce.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix flour and dashi stock (or water) until smooth batter forms;Add eggs and whisk thoroughly to combine;Add shredded cabbage, chopped green onions, tenkasu, and a pinch of salt to the batter;Mix everything gently until well incorporated;Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add a tablespoon of vegetable oil;Pour half of the batter into the pan and spread it evenly into a round pancake about 7-8 inches in diameter;Lay 3 slices of pork belly evenly on top of the batter;Cook for about 4-5 minutes until the bottom is golden brown and the edges start to set;Carefully flip the okonomiyaki using a spatula, making sure the pork side is now on the bottom;Press down lightly and cook for another 4-5 minutes until the pork is cooked through and the pancake is firm;Flip again if needed to ensure both sides are evenly cooked;Transfer the okonomiyaki to a plate;Brush a generous amount of okonomiyaki sauce on top;Drizzle Japanese mayonnaise in a zigzag pattern over the sauce;Sprinkle aonori and katsuobushi flakes evenly on top;Add pickled ginger on the side if using;Repeat the steps for the second okonomiyaki with remaining ingredients;Serve hot and enjoy!

title: Gyudon
description: Rice bowl topped with thinly sliced beef and onions simmered in a sweet and savory soy-based sauce, often served with a raw or poached egg.
ingredients: Thinly sliced beef (ribeye or chuck): 300g; Onion: 1 medium, thinly sliced; Dashi stock: 200ml; Soy sauce: 3 tbsp; Mirin: 3 tbsp; Sake: 2 tbsp; Sugar: 1 tbsp; Cooked Japanese short-grain rice: 2 bowls; Pickled ginger (beni shoga): to serve; Green onions, chopped: for garnish; Optional: Soft boiled egg or raw egg yolk for topping
instructions: Prepare the dashi stock or use instant dashi powder dissolved in water; In a medium pan, combine dashi, soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar; Bring the mixture to a gentle boil over medium heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar; Add the sliced onions and cook until they become translucent and soft, about 5-7 minutes; Add the thinly sliced beef to the pan, spreading it out evenly; Cook the beef gently in the simmering sauce, stirring occasionally until the meat is just cooked through, about 3-4 minutes; Taste the sauce and adjust seasoning if needed, adding a little more soy sauce or sugar if desired; Remove from heat; To serve, divide the hot steamed rice into bowls; Spoon the beef and onion mixture generously over the rice along with some of the sauce; Garnish with chopped green onions and a small amount of pickled ginger; Optionally, top each bowl with a soft boiled egg or raw egg yolk for extra richness

title: Onigiri
description: Rice balls shaped by hand, often wrapped in seaweed and filled with savory ingredients like pickled plum, salmon, or tuna mayo.
ingredients: Japanese short-grain rice: 2 cups; Water: 2.5 cups; Salt: 1 tsp; Nori (seaweed) sheets: 3-4, cut into strips; Filling (choose one): salted salmon flakes, tuna mayo, pickled plum (umeboshi), or cooked seasoned vegetables
instructions: Rinse the rice under cold water until water runs clear; Drain and soak rice in water for 30 minutes; Cook rice with water in a rice cooker or pot; When cooked, let rice rest covered for 10 minutes; Wet your hands with water and rub a pinch of salt on your palms; Take a handful of rice and flatten it slightly; Place 1 tsp of your chosen filling in the center; Mold the rice around the filling into a triangular or oval shape; Press gently but firmly to keep shape; Wrap a strip of nori around the bottom or side of the rice ball; Serve immediately or wrap in plastic wrap to keep fresh until eating.

title: Udon Soup
description: Udon Soup features thick, chewy Japanese udon noodles served in a mild broth made from dashi, soy sauce, and mirin, often topped with tempura, vegetables, or meat.
ingredients: Udon noodles (fresh or frozen): 300g; Dashi stock (or water with dashi powder): 4 cups; Soy sauce: 3 tbsp; Mirin: 2 tbsp; Sake: 1 tbsp; Sugar: 1 tsp; Green onions: 2, sliced; Shiitake mushrooms: 4, sliced; Tofu (optional): 150g, cubed; Wakame seaweed (optional): 1 tbsp; Salt: to taste
instructions: Prepare the dashi stock by heating 4 cups of water and adding dashi powder if not using ready-made stock;Bring the dashi stock to a gentle simmer over medium heat;Add soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar to the simmering stock;Stir the broth well to dissolve the sugar and mix the seasonings evenly;Add sliced shiitake mushrooms and tofu cubes to the broth;Simmer the broth for 5 to 7 minutes until mushrooms are tender and tofu is heated through;Meanwhile, cook the udon noodles separately according to package instructions until they are just tender;Drain the noodles well and divide them into serving bowls;Add optional wakame seaweed to the broth and simmer for another minute;Pour the hot broth with mushrooms and tofu over the noodles in each bowl;Garnish with sliced green onions on top and add salt if needed;Serve immediately while hot.

title: Nasi Lemak
description: Malaysias national dish made of coconut rice served with sambal, fried anchovies, boiled egg, cucumber, and peanuts. It is often accompanied by fried chicken or rendang.
ingredients:
Rice: 2 cups;Coconut Milk: 400 ml;Water: 300 ml;Pandan Leaves: 2, knotted;Salt: 1 tsp
Ikan Bilis (Dried Anchovies): 1 cup;Peanuts: 1/2 cup;Cucumber: 1, sliced;Eggs: 4, boiled
Oil: 4 tbsp
Onion: 1 large, thinly sliced;Garlic: 3 cloves, minced;Ginger: 1 inch, minced
Dried Chilies: 10, soaked and blended;Shallots: 5, blended;Tamarind Paste: 1 tbsp;Sugar: 1 tbsp;Salt: to taste
instructions:
Rinse the rice until the water runs clear;Place rice in a rice cooker with coconut milk, water, pandan leaves, and salt;Stir to combine and cook as usual until done.
Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a pan;Fry the dried anchovies until crispy;Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add peanuts;Toast them over low heat until golden brown;Remove and set aside.
Boil the eggs for 10 minutes;Cool in cold water and peel;Slice each egg in half.
Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a saucepan;Add sliced onions, garlic, and ginger;Sauté until fragrant and soft.
Add blended dried chilies and shallots;Cook over medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes until oil separates from the paste.
Stir in tamarind paste, sugar, and salt;Simmer for another 3 to 5 minutes until the sambal thickens slightly;Adjust seasoning to taste.
To serve, place a scoop of coconut rice on a plate;Add sambal, fried anchovies, peanuts, sliced cucumber, and half a boiled egg on the side.

title: Rendang
description: Slow-cooked dry curry featuring beef simmered in coconut milk and a spice paste until tender and deeply flavorful.
ingredients: Beef (cubed): 1kg;Coconut Milk: 400ml;Desiccated Coconut (kerisik): 3 tbsp;Shallots: 10, peeled and sliced;Garlic: 5 cloves;Ginger: 2 inches;Galangal: 1 inch;Lemongrass: 2 stalks, white part only, smashed;Dried Chilies (soaked and blended): 10;Turmeric Leaf: 1, shredded (optional);Kaffir Lime Leaves: 5;Tamarind Juice: 2 tbsp;Palm Sugar: 1 tbsp;Salt: to taste;Cooking Oil: 4 tbsp
instructions: Blend shallots, garlic, ginger, galangal, and soaked dried chilies into a smooth paste;Heat oil in a large wok or pot over medium heat;Add the blended spice paste and sauté until fragrant and oil begins to separate from the paste, about 10 to 15 minutes;Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and turmeric leaf, then stir for 2 to 3 minutes;Add the beef cubes and stir to coat them evenly in the spice mixture;Pour in the coconut milk and tamarind juice, then bring the mixture to a boil;Lower the heat and simmer uncovered, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, for about 1 hour;Add the desiccated coconut (kerisik) and palm sugar, then continue to cook on low heat;Stir often and reduce the sauce until it becomes thick and the oil rises to the top;Season with salt to taste and continue cooking until the beef is fork-tender and the rendang is dry and dark brown in color;Remove from heat and let it sit for a few minutes before serving.

title: Satay
description: Southeast Asian dish of marinated meat skewers grilled over open flame, served with a rich peanut sauce and sometimes with rice cakes and cucumber.
ingredients: Chicken thigh (boneless, skinless): 1kg, cut into small cubes;Lemongrass: 2 stalks, finely chopped (white part only);Garlic: 4 cloves, minced;Shallots: 6, minced;Ginger: 1 inch, grated;Turmeric powder: 1 tsp;Coriander powder: 1 tbsp;Cumin powder: 1 tsp;Brown sugar: 2 tbsp;Soy sauce: 2 tbsp;Salt: 1 tsp;Oil: 2 tbsp;Bamboo skewers: 20 sticks (soaked in water 30 mins before use)
instructions: Prepare the marinade by blending lemongrass, garlic, shallots, and ginger into a paste using a food processor or mortar and pestle;Transfer the paste to a large bowl and add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, brown sugar, soy sauce, salt, and oil;Mix everything thoroughly until it becomes a thick, fragrant marinade;Add the chicken cubes into the marinade and stir well to coat each piece evenly;Cover the bowl and marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight for better flavor absorption;Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto the soaked bamboo skewers, packing them snugly but not too tight;Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat and lightly oil the surface to prevent sticking;Grill the satay skewers in batches, turning every 2 to 3 minutes to ensure even cooking;Brush the skewers occasionally with leftover marinade or oil to keep them moist;Grill until the chicken is cooked through and slightly charred at the edges, about 10 to 12 minutes in total per batch;Serve hot with peanut sauce, cucumber slices, and compressed rice (nasi impit)

title: Mee Goreng
description: Spicy stir-fried noodles with vegetables and meat.
ingredients: Yellow noodles: 400g;Chicken breast (sliced thin): 200g;Prawns (peeled and deveined): 100g;Firm tofu (cubed): 100g;Garlic: 3 cloves, minced;Shallots: 2, sliced thinly;Eggs: 2;Choy sum or cabbage: 1 cup, chopped;Tomato: 1, cut into wedges;Bean sprouts: 1 cup;Soy sauce: 2 tbsp;Dark soy sauce: 1 tbsp;Chili paste: 1 tbsp;Sweet soy sauce (kicap manis): 1 tbsp;Salt: to taste;Oil: 3 tbsp;Lime: 1, cut into wedges
instructions:
Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a large wok over medium heat;Add sliced shallots and minced garlic;Sauté for 1 to 2 minutes until fragrant and golden.
Add tofu cubes;Fry until all sides are golden brown;Push to the side of the wok.
Add chicken slices and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until browned;Add prawns and stir-fry until they turn pink and are just cooked through.
Push everything to the side;Crack in the eggs;Let them set slightly before scrambling and mixing with other ingredients.
Add chili paste;Stir-fry for 1 minute to bring out the aroma.
Add yellow noodles;Use tongs or two spatulas to toss and combine thoroughly with the rest of the ingredients.
Pour in soy sauce, dark soy sauce, and sweet soy sauce;Mix well so noodles are evenly coated and darkened in color.
Add chopped choy sum or cabbage and tomato wedges;Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp and tomatoes slightly softened.
Add bean sprouts;Toss briefly to keep them crunchy.
Season with salt to taste;Drizzle remaining 1 tbsp oil around the edges and give everything a final toss.
Turn off heat;Serve hot with a wedge of lime on the side for squeezing.

title: Ayam Masak Merah
description: Malaysian tomato-based chicken dish where fried chicken is simmered in a spicy tomato gravy with onions, spices, and sometimes peas.
ingredients: Chicken (cut into medium pieces): 1 kg;Salt: to taste;Turmeric powder: 1 tsp (for marinating);Oil: 5 tbsp (for frying and cooking);Onion: 2 large, sliced;Garlic: 4 cloves;Ginger: 1 inch piece;Tomato sauce: 1 cup;Chili paste: 4 tbsp (adjust to spice preference);Cinnamon stick: 1;Star anise: 1;Cloves: 3;Cardamom pods: 2;Sugar: 1 tbsp;Water: 1 cup;Frozen peas (optional): 1/2 cup;Fried shallots (for garnish): a handful
instructions:
Marinate the chicken with salt and turmeric powder;Heat 3 tbsp oil in a pan and shallow-fry the chicken until lightly browned on the outside;Remove and set aside.
Blend garlic, ginger, and one sliced onion until smooth;Heat 2 tbsp oil in a clean pan, then add the blended paste and cook over medium heat until fragrant and slightly caramelized.
Add cinnamon stick, star anise, cloves, and cardamom;Stir for 1 to 2 minutes until the spices release their aroma.
Add chili paste and continue stirring;Cook until the oil separates from the paste, indicating that the chili paste is well-cooked.
Pour in tomato sauce and mix well;Add sugar and stir;Cook for about 5 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Return the fried chicken to the pan;Add water and mix to coat the chicken evenly with the sauce.
Lower the heat and cover the pan;Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes until the chicken is tender and the sauce has reduced slightly.
Add frozen peas if using;Cook for another 5 minutes to heat through.
Turn off the heat;Garnish with fried shallots before serving.

title: Nasi Kerabu
description: Nasi Kerabu is a vibrant Malaysian rice dish featuring blue-colored rice cooked with butterfly pea flowers. It is traditionally served with fresh herbs, toasted coconut, salted egg, spicy sambal, and grilled or fried fish or chicken. This flavorful combination offers a unique blend of floral, spicy, and savory tastes, making it a beloved delicacy from the east coast of Malaysia.
ingredients: Blue rice (cooked with butterfly pea flower): 4 cups;Grated coconut (fresh): 1 cup;Shredded kaffir lime leaves: 3 leaves;Salt: to taste;Lemongrass (chopped finely): 2 stalks;Dry-fried fish or grilled chicken: 1 whole or 4 pieces;Sambal (spicy sauce): ½ cup;Fresh herbs (daun kesum, daun selom, bean sprouts, long beans  to  finely sliced): 1 cup total;Salted egg (halved): 2 eggs;Keropok (fish crackers): a handful;Torch ginger bud (bunga kantan, sliced): ½ bud
instructions:
Cook the rice with butterfly pea flowers until soft and evenly blue;Fluff the rice and keep warm.
Toast grated coconut in a dry pan over medium heat until golden brown and aromatic;Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Pound or blend the toasted coconut with salt, lemongrass, and shredded kaffir lime leaves to make kerisik;Mix well and set aside.
Grill or fry fish or chicken until fully cooked and crispy on the outside;Set aside to serve later.
Prepare sambal by blending chilies, garlic, onion, and shrimp paste;Cook the mixture in oil until fragrant and thick;Season with salt and sugar to balance the heat.
Thinly slice all fresh herbs and vegetables;Mix them gently to create the fresh ulam (herb salad).
Slice the salted eggs into halves;Fry the fish crackers until crispy if not already done.
To serve, place blue rice on a plate;Top with toasted coconut mixture (kerisik), herb salad, grilled meat or fish, sambal, half a salted egg, and keropok;Garnish with sliced bunga kantan for fragrance.

title: Sambal Udang
description: Malaysian prawn dish cooked in a spicy sambal chili paste, often combined with tamarind juice for a tangy kick.
ingredients: Prawns (medium to large, peeled and deveined): 500g;Dried Chilies: 20 pieces (soaked in hot water);Shallots: 6;Garlic: 4 cloves;Tamarind paste: 1 tbsp (mixed with 3 tbsp water);Sugar: 1 tbsp;Salt: to taste;Oil: 3 tbsp;Onion: 1, sliced;Belacan (fermented shrimp paste): 1 tsp (optional);Water: 50ml
instructions: Blend dried chilies, shallots, and garlic into a smooth paste;Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and sauté the chili paste until fragrant and the oil separates, about 10-12 minutes;Add belacan and continue to sauté for another 2-3 minutes until well mixed;Add sliced onion and cook until slightly soft;Add tamarind juice, sugar, and salt;Stir well and let the sambal simmer for 3-4 minutes;Add prawns and stir to coat them evenly with the sambal;Pour in water and let the prawns cook until they turn pink and are fully cooked, about 5-7 minutes;Taste and adjust seasoning as needed;Turn off the heat and serve hot with rice

title: Lontong
description: Festive Malaysian and Indonesian dish featuring compressed rice cakes served with coconut milk-based vegetable curry and sometimes boiled eggs or sambal.

title: Kerabu Mangga
description: Spicy, tangy Thai-inspired mango salad from Malaysia made with shredded green mango, chili, lime, and toasted peanuts or dried shrimp.
instructions:
Peel the green mango and shred it finely using a grater or knife; place in a large mixing bowl and set aside.
Slice the shallots and red chilies very thinly; add them to the bowl with the shredded mango.
Chop the fresh coriander leaves roughly and add into the bowl.
If using dried shrimp, toast them lightly in a dry pan until fragrant, then crush roughly and add to the bowl.
In a small bowl, combine lime juice, fish sauce (or soy sauce), sugar, and a pinch of salt; stir well until the sugar dissolves completely to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the mango mixture; toss everything together gently but thoroughly so that the mango and other ingredients are evenly coated with the dressing.
Add the roasted peanuts and fresh mint leaves; give a final gentle toss to mix.
Taste the salad and adjust seasoning with more lime juice, sugar, or salt as needed.
Serve immediately for the freshest taste or chill for 10-15 minutes to let the flavors meld before serving.

title: Bubur Lambuk
description: Malaysian porridge dish made with rice, spices, coconut milk, and meat, commonly enjoyed during Ramadan as a hearty iftar meal.
instructions: Rinse the rice until water runs clear; soak for 15 minutes then drain;Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; add onions, garlic, ginger, shallots, and lemongrass; sauté gently until fragrant and translucent;Add beef cubes and cook until lightly browned on all sides; sprinkle curry powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and chili powder over the meat; stir well to coat the beef evenly with the spices;Pour in water and bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes until beef is tender and rice begins to soften;Stir occasionally to prevent rice from sticking to the bottom; after 30 minutes, add the drained rice to the pot; mix thoroughly;Continue cooking on low heat, stirring frequently; pour in coconut milk, salt, and sugar; stir well and cook until the rice breaks down and the porridge becomes thick and creamy (about 15 to 20 minutes);Remove lemongrass stalk; taste and adjust seasoning if needed;Serve hot, garnished with fried shallots and fresh chopped cilantro or daun sup; provide lime wedges on the side for a fresh, tangy kick if desired.

title: Butter Chicken
description: Rich Indian dish featuring marinated chicken cooked in a creamy tomato-based sauce with butter and aromatic spices, typically served with naan or rice.

title: Palak Paneer
description: North Indian vegetarian dish of paneer cheese cubes cooked in a creamy spinach gravy seasoned with spices and garlic.
ingredients: Fresh spinach (palak): 500g; Paneer (Indian cottage cheese): 250g; Onion: 1 medium, finely chopped; Tomato: 1 medium, chopped; Garlic: 4 cloves, minced; Ginger: 1 inch piece, grated; Green chili: 1, chopped (optional); Cumin seeds: 1 tsp; Garam masala: 1 tsp; Red chili powder: 1/2 tsp; Turmeric powder: 1/4 tsp; Fresh cream or yogurt: 2 tbsp (optional); Oil or ghee: 2 tbsp; Salt: to taste; Water: as needed
instructions: Wash spinach leaves thoroughly to remove dirt; Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes until wilted; Drain and immediately transfer to cold water to preserve green color; Drain again and blend spinach into a smooth puree; Heat oil or ghee in a pan over medium heat; Add cumin seeds and let them splutter; Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown; Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili; Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant; Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil starts to separate; Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt; Stir well and cook for a minute; Pour in the spinach puree and mix thoroughly; Add some water if the mixture is too thick; Cook the spinach mixture for 5-7 minutes on medium heat; Add garam masala and stir; Cut paneer into cubes and gently add to the spinach gravy; Cook for 3-4 minutes to let paneer absorb flavors; Stir in fresh cream or yogurt for richness, if using; Adjust salt and spice levels to taste; Remove from heat and serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

title: Chicken Biryani
description: Fragrant Indian rice dish cooked with marinated chicken, basmati rice, and spices, layered and steamed for a rich, flavorful meal.
ingredients: Chicken (cut into pieces): 1 kg; Basmati rice: 2 cups; Onions (thinly sliced): 2 large; Tomatoes (chopped): 2 medium; Garlic paste: 1 tbsp; Ginger paste: 1 tbsp; Green chilies (slit): 2; Yogurt: 1 cup; Biryani masala powder: 2 tbsp; Turmeric powder: 1/2 tsp; Red chili powder: 1 tsp; Garam masala powder: 1 tsp; Fresh coriander leaves (chopped): 1/2 cup; Fresh mint leaves (chopped): 1/2 cup; Lemon juice: 2 tbsp; Cooking oil: 4 tbsp; Ghee (clarified butter): 2 tbsp; Whole spices (bay leaf-1, cloves-4, cinnamon stick-1 inch, cardamom pods-4); Salt: to taste; Water: 4 cups
instructions:
Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes; Drain and keep aside.
Heat oil in a heavy-bottom pan; Add whole spices and sauté until fragrant.
Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown; Remove half of the fried onions and keep aside for garnishing.
Add ginger paste, garlic paste, and green chilies; Sauté for 2 minutes until raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and oil starts to separate.
Add chicken pieces; Stir and cook on medium heat until chicken changes color.
Add yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala, and salt; Mix well to coat the chicken with spices.
Cook covered for 10-15 minutes on low heat until chicken is partially cooked and oil separates.
Meanwhile, boil 4 cups of water in a large pot; Add salt and soaked rice; Cook rice until it is 70% done; Drain and set aside.
Layer the partially cooked chicken in the pan; Sprinkle chopped coriander, mint leaves, garam masala, and lemon juice evenly over the chicken.
Add a layer of the partially cooked rice on top of the chicken; Spread the reserved fried onions over the rice; Drizzle ghee evenly.
Cover the pan tightly with a lid; Cook on very low heat (dum) for 25-30 minutes to allow flavors to blend and rice to fully cook.
Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes before opening the lid.
Gently fluff the biryani with a fork; Serve hot with raita or salad.

title: Chole
description: Dish made with chickpeas simmered in a spicy, tangy tomato-based gravy, often served with rice or flatbread.

title: Samosa
description: Deep-fried pastry with a savory filling, typically of spiced potatoes, peas, and sometimes meat, commonly eaten as a snack or appetizer in South Asia.

title: Paneer Tikka
description: Vegetarian Indian dish where cubes of paneer cheese are marinated in yogurt and spices, then grilled or roasted until charred.

title: Aloo Gobi
description: Dry Indian curry featuring potatoes (aloo) and cauliflower (gobi) sautéed with turmeric, cumin, and other spices.
ingredients: Potatoes (Aloo): 3 medium, peeled and diced;Cauliflower (Gobi): 1 medium head, cut into florets;Onion: 1 large, finely chopped;Tomato: 1 medium, chopped;Green chili: 1, slit (optional);Ginger: 1 inch, grated;Garlic: 3 cloves, minced;Cumin seeds: 1 tsp;Turmeric powder: 1/2 tsp;Red chili powder: 1/2 tsp;Coriander powder: 1 tsp;Garam masala: 1/2 tsp;Salt: to taste;Oil: 3 tbsp;Fresh coriander leaves: for garnish
instructions: Heat oil in a pan until hot;Add cumin seeds and let them splutter;Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown;Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili;Sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant;Add chopped tomato and cook until soft and mushy;Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt;Mix spices well with the tomato mixture;Add diced potatoes and cauliflower florets;Stir everything gently to coat vegetables with the spices;Cover the pan with a lid and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes;Check occasionally and stir carefully to avoid sticking;If needed, sprinkle a little water to prevent burning;Cook until potatoes and cauliflower are tender but not mushy;Sprinkle garam masala and mix gently;Turn off the heat and garnish with fresh coriander leaves;Serve hot with chapati or rice.

title: Tandoori Chicken
description: Indian dish made by marinating chicken in yogurt and spices, then roasting it in a tandoor (clay oven) until smoky and tender.
instructions: Clean the chicken and pat dry with paper towels;Make deep cuts on the chicken to allow marinade to penetrate;In a large bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, garlic paste, ginger paste, garam masala, cumin, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, salt, oil, and food coloring if using;Whisk the marinade until smooth and well combined;Coat the chicken thoroughly with the marinade, making sure to rub inside the cuts;Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, preferably overnight;Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F);Place the marinated chicken on a baking tray lined with foil or on a grill rack;Bake or grill the chicken for 25 to 30 minutes, turning halfway through to ensure even cooking;Check that the chicken is cooked through by piercing the thickest partjuices should run clear;For a charred effect, broil the chicken for the last 2-3 minutes;Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes before serving;Serve hot with sliced onions, lemon wedges, and mint chutney.

title: Roti
description: Simple, soft flatbread made with whole wheat flour, commonly served with curries, lentils, or vegetables.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix whole wheat flour and salt evenly; slowly add water little by little while stirring with your hand or a spoon to form a rough dough; Once all water is added, knead the dough in the bowl for about 8-10 minutes until it becomes soft and pliable; If the dough feels sticky, sprinkle a little dry flour and continue kneading; Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for at least 30 minutes to relax the gluten; After resting, knead the dough again briefly and divide it into small equal-sized balls, about golf ball size; Lightly dust your rolling surface and rolling pin with dry flour to prevent sticking; Take one dough ball and flatten it slightly; Roll it out evenly into a thin, round disc about 6-8 inches in diameter; Heat a flat skillet or tava over medium-high heat until hot; Place the rolled roti on the hot skillet; Cook for about 30 seconds or until you see bubbles forming on the surface; Flip the roti using tongs or spatula and cook the other side for 30 seconds until light brown spots appear; Flip again and press gently with a clean cloth or spatula to encourage puffing; When the roti puffs up fully, flip once more to cook evenly; Remove from the skillet and brush lightly with ghee or butter if desired; Repeat the rolling and cooking process with the remaining dough balls; Serve hot with curry or vegetables.

title: Dal Tadka
description: Lentils dish made with yellow lentils simmered until soft, then tempered with spices, garlic, and ghee for added flavor.

title: Kung Pao Chicken
description: Classic Sichuan stir-fry made with chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and dried chilies in a tangy and spicy sauce.

title: Char Kue Teow
description: Malaysian stir-fried flat rice noodle dish cooked with soy sauce, prawns, eggs, bean sprouts, and Chinese sausage.

title: Chinese Fried Rice
description: Versatile dish of stir-fried rice with eggs, vegetables, and often chicken or shrimp, flavored with soy sauce and sesame oil.
ingredients: Cooked rice (preferably day-old): 4 cups; Eggs: 2; Cooking oil: 3 tbsp; Garlic: 3 cloves, minced; Onion: 1 small, diced; Carrots: 1/2 cup, diced; Frozen peas: 1/2 cup; Green onions: 2 stalks, chopped; Soy sauce: 2 tbsp; Oyster sauce (optional): 1 tbsp; Salt: to taste; White pepper: a pinch
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat; Crack the eggs into the pan and scramble quickly until just set; Remove eggs and set aside; Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the pan; Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant and translucent, about 1-2 minutes; Add diced carrots and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly tender; Stir in frozen peas and cook for another minute; Add the cold cooked rice, breaking up any clumps with a spatula; Stir-fry the rice, mixing it thoroughly with the vegetables; Drizzle soy sauce and oyster sauce evenly over the rice; Stir continuously to coat the rice evenly and heat through; Return the scrambled eggs to the pan and mix them into the rice; Season with salt and white pepper to taste; Finally, sprinkle chopped green onions over the rice and give a quick stir; Serve hot immediately.

title: Spring Rolls
description: Crispy appetizers filled with vegetables and sometimes meat, wrapped in thin pastry and deep-fried or served fresh with dipping sauce.
instructions: Heat a tablespoon of vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat;Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant;Add cabbage, carrot, bean sprouts, and green onions;Stir-fry vegetables for about 3-4 minutes until slightly softened;Season with soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and pepper;Cook for another 1-2 minutes and remove from heat;Let the filling cool slightly;Place one spring roll wrapper on a clean surface in a diamond shape;Spoon about 2 tablespoons of filling near the bottom corner;Fold the bottom corner over the filling;Fold in the left and right corners toward the center;Roll tightly toward the top corner;Seal the edge with cornstarch paste;Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling;Heat vegetable oil in a deep pan or wok to 350°F (175°C);Fry spring rolls in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 3-5 minutes;Remove and drain on paper towels;Serve hot with dipping sauce of choice.

title: Mapo Tofu
description: Spicy Sichuan dish made with soft tofu, minced pork or beef, and a chili bean sauce, topped with Sichuan peppercorns for a numbing heat.
ingredients: Soft tofu: 400g, cut into cubes;Ground pork: 200g;Garlic: 3 cloves, minced;Ginger: 1 inch piece, minced;Green onions: 2, chopped;Doubanjiang (fermented chili bean paste): 2 tbsp;Soy sauce: 1 tbsp;Shaoxing wine (or dry sherry): 1 tbsp;Chicken broth or water: 150ml;Cornstarch: 1 tsp, mixed with 2 tsp water;Sichuan peppercorn powder: 1 tsp;Sugar: 1 tsp;Oil (vegetable or canola): 2 tbsp
instructions: Heat the oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat;Add the minced garlic, ginger, and half of the green onions;Stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant but not burnt;Add the ground pork;Break it apart with your spatula and cook until browned and no longer pink;Add the doubanjiang (chili bean paste) and stir well to coat the pork;Cook for 1-2 minutes to release the flavors;Pour in the Shaoxing wine and let it evaporate for a few seconds;Add the soy sauce, sugar, and chicken broth or water;Bring the mixture to a simmer;Gently add the tofu cubes, being careful not to break them;Simmer gently for about 5 minutes to allow the tofu to absorb the flavors;Stir the cornstarch slurry and slowly pour it into the pan while gently stirring;Cook until the sauce thickens and becomes glossy;Sprinkle the Sichuan peppercorn powder evenly and give a gentle stir;Turn off the heat and garnish with the remaining chopped green onions;Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Chow Mein
description: Chinese stir-fried noodle dish tossed with vegetables, meat or shrimp, and a savory soy-based sauce.
ingredients: Egg noodles: 300g; Chicken breast or beef: 250g, thinly sliced; Carrot: 1 medium, julienned; Bell pepper: 1, thinly sliced; Cabbage: 1 cup, shredded; Green onions: 3, chopped; Garlic: 3 cloves, minced; Soy sauce: 4 tbsp; Oyster sauce: 2 tbsp; Sesame oil: 1 tsp; Vegetable oil: 3 tbsp; Salt: to taste; Black pepper: to taste; Water or chicken broth: 1/4 cup
instructions: Boil egg noodles in salted water until just tender; drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking; set aside;Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat; add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant but not browned;Add sliced chicken or beef and stir-fry until cooked through and no longer pink; remove meat from pan and set aside;In the same pan, add a bit more oil if needed; add carrots, bell pepper, and cabbage; stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender;Return the cooked meat to the pan with the vegetables; toss to combine;Add the cooked noodles to the pan; pour in soy sauce, oyster sauce, and water or broth; stir everything thoroughly to mix the sauce evenly;Cook for 2-3 minutes, allowing the noodles to absorb the flavors; drizzle sesame oil over the top; season with salt and black pepper to taste; toss again gently;Turn off heat and sprinkle chopped green onions on top; serve immediately while hot.

title: Egg Drop Soup
description: light Chinese soup made with beaten eggs stirred into hot broth to create silky ribbons, often flavored with scallions and white pepper.
ingredients: Chicken broth: 4 cups;Eggs: 2 large;Cornstarch: 1 tbsp;Water: 2 tbsp;Ginger: 1 tsp grated;Salt: 1/2 tsp;White pepper: 1/4 tsp;Green onions: 2 stalks, sliced;Sesame oil: 1 tsp (optional)
instructions: In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smooth;Heat chicken broth in a pot over medium heat until it begins to simmer;Add grated ginger, salt, and white pepper to the broth;Stir in the cornstarch mixture to thicken the broth slightly;Beat the eggs lightly in a separate bowl;Slowly pour the beaten eggs into the simmering broth in a thin stream while stirring gently with a fork or chopsticks;Continue stirring until egg ribbons form and cook fully;Remove from heat and add sliced green onions and sesame oil if using;Serve hot immediately.

title: Dim Sum
description: Variety of small Chinese dishes such as dumplings, buns, and rolls, traditionally served with tea in a communal dining experience.

title: Steamed Fish
description: Chinese-style whole fish dish often seasoned with ginger, soy sauce, and scallions, then gently steamed for a delicate flavor.

title: Char Siu
description: Cantonese-style barbecued pork that is marinated in a sweet and savory sauce and roasted until caramelized and tender.
ingredients: Pork shoulder (boneless): 1 kg;Honey: 3 tbsp;Soy sauce (light): 4 tbsp;Hoisin sauce: 3 tbsp;Chinese five-spice powder: 1 tsp;Shaoxing wine (or dry sherry): 2 tbsp;Brown sugar: 2 tbsp;Garlic (minced): 3 cloves;Red food coloring (optional): a few drops
instructions: Mix honey, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, five-spice powder, Shaoxing wine, brown sugar, minced garlic, and red food coloring in a bowl to create the marinade;Slice the pork shoulder into long strips about 2 inches wide for even cooking;Place pork strips in the marinade, cover well, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight for best flavor;Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F) and line a baking tray with foil, placing a wire rack on top;Arrange the marinated pork strips on the rack, reserving the leftover marinade;Roast the pork for 15 minutes, then baste with the reserved marinade and turn the pieces over;Continue roasting for another 15 minutes, basting again halfway through, until the pork is cooked through and nicely caramelized;For a sticky glaze, increase the oven temperature to 220°C (430°F) in the last 5 minutes, watching carefully to avoid burning;Remove from oven and let the char siu rest for 5 minutes before slicing;Serve sliced pork with steamed rice or in bao buns.

title: Kimchi Fried Rice
description: Korean dish where cooked rice is stir-fried with kimchi, garlic, and gochujang, often topped with a fried egg.
ingredients: Cooked rice: 3 cups (preferably day-old);Kimchi: 1 cup, chopped;Kimchi juice: 2 tbsp;Eggs: 2;Green onion: 2 stalks, chopped;Garlic: 2 cloves, minced;Soy sauce: 1 tbsp;Sesame oil: 1 tbsp;Vegetable oil: 2 tbsp;Sugar: 1 tsp;Salt: to taste;Sesame seeds: 1 tsp (optional);Fried seaweed strips: for garnish (optional)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat;Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds;Add chopped kimchi and cook for 3-4 minutes until soft and slightly caramelized;Pour in kimchi juice and stir well;Add the cooked rice, breaking up any clumps with a spatula;Mix thoroughly with kimchi until rice is evenly coated and heated through;Add soy sauce and sugar, stir well to balance flavors;Push the rice to one side of the pan and crack eggs into the empty space;Scramble eggs gently until mostly cooked, then mix eggs into the rice evenly;Add chopped green onions and drizzle sesame oil over the mixture;Taste and add salt if needed, mix everything well;Remove from heat and serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds and fried seaweed strips if using.

title: Bibimbap
description: Korean rice bowl topped with assorted vegetables, meat, and a fried egg, mixed with gochujang (chili paste) before eating.

title: Bulgogi
description: Korean dish of thinly sliced beef marinated in a sweet soy-based sauce, then grilled or stir-fried until tender and flavorful.
ingredients: Beef sirloin or ribeye (thinly sliced): 500g;Soy sauce: 5 tbsp;Brown sugar: 2 tbsp;Sesame oil: 1 tbsp;Garlic (minced): 3 cloves;Green onion (chopped): 2 stalks;Ground black pepper: 1/2 tsp;Grated Asian pear or apple: 1/2 small;Carrot (julienned): 1 small;Onion (thinly sliced): 1 medium;Sesame seeds: 1 tbsp;Cooking oil: 1 tbsp
instructions: In a large bowl, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, grated pear (or apple), chopped green onions, and ground black pepper;Mix well until sugar is dissolved and marinade is uniform;Add the thinly sliced beef to the marinade;Toss the beef thoroughly so each piece is evenly coated with the marinade;Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, ideally 1-2 hours to let the flavors develop;Heat cooking oil in a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat;Add the sliced onions and julienned carrots to the pan and sauté for about 2 minutes until slightly softened;Add the marinated beef slices to the pan, spreading them out evenly;Cook the beef without stirring for 2-3 minutes to get a nice sear;Then stir-fry, turning the beef pieces until fully cooked and caramelized, about another 3-4 minutes;Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds over the cooked beef and mix gently;Serve hot with steamed rice and optional side dishes like kimchi or lettuce wraps.

title: Tteokbokki
description: Spicy Korean street food made with chewy rice cakes cooked in a fiery gochujang sauce, often with fish cakes and boiled eggs.

title: Japchae
description: Korean noodle dish made with stir-fried glass noodles, vegetables, and meat, flavored with soy sauce and sesame oil.
instructions: Soak sweet potato noodles in warm water for 20-30 minutes until softened; drain and set aside;Boil a pot of water, add noodles and cook for 5-6 minutes until translucent and chewy; drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking; toss with 1 tbsp sesame oil to prevent sticking;Marinate beef slices in 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp sugar, and a pinch of pepper for 10 minutes;Heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat; stir-fry marinated beef until cooked through; remove and set aside;In the same pan, add 1 tbsp vegetable oil; sauté garlic and onion until fragrant and translucent; add carrot and mushrooms; cook until vegetables are tender but still crisp; remove and set aside;In a large bowl, combine noodles, cooked beef, sautéed vegetables, and blanched spinach;Add remaining soy sauce, sugar, and 1 tbsp sesame oil; toss everything well to mix flavors evenly;Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper to taste;Transfer to serving plate; sprinkle toasted sesame seeds and chopped green onion on top; serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Kimchi Stew
description: (Kimchi Jjigae) is a Korean hot pot made with aged kimchi, tofu, pork, and spicy broth, commonly served bubbling hot.
ingredients: Kimchi (preferably fermented): 2 cups, chopped;Pork belly or shoulder: 200g, sliced thinly;Tofu: 1 block, cut into cubes;Onion: 1 medium, sliced;Garlic: 3 cloves, minced;Green onion: 2 stalks, chopped;Gochugaru (Korean red chili flakes): 1 tbsp;Gochujang (Korean chili paste): 1 tbsp;Soy sauce: 1 tbsp;Sesame oil: 1 tsp;Water or broth: 3 cups;Salt: to taste;Sugar: 1 tsp (optional)
instructions: Heat a pot over medium heat and add sesame oil;Add minced garlic and sliced onions, sauté until fragrant and translucent;Add pork slices and cook until they start to brown;Add chopped kimchi and stir-fry together with the pork for about 5 minutes until the kimchi softens and releases aroma;Add gochugaru and gochujang, stirring well to mix all flavors;Pour in the water or broth and bring the mixture to a boil;Once boiling, reduce heat to medium-low and let it simmer for 20 minutes so flavors meld;Add soy sauce and adjust salt to taste;Add tofu cubes gently into the stew;Simmer for another 5-7 minutes without stirring too hard to avoid breaking tofu;Finally, sprinkle chopped green onions on top before serving;Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Korean Fried Chicken
description: Double-fried chicken known for its crispy exterior, often coated in a sweet and spicy sauce or soy garlic glaze.
instructions: Prepare chicken by patting dry with paper towels; In a large bowl, combine cornstarch, all-purpose flour, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder; Toss the chicken pieces in the flour mixture until fully coated; Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or heavy pot to 175°C (350°F); Fry the chicken in batches to avoid overcrowding; Cook for 8-10 minutes until golden brown and crispy; Remove and drain on paper towels; While frying, prepare the sauce by mixing soy sauce, gochujang, honey, brown sugar, rice vinegar, minced garlic, grated ginger, sesame oil, and water in a saucepan; Bring the sauce to a simmer over medium heat; Stir constantly until the sugar dissolves and the sauce thickens slightly; Place fried chicken in a large bowl; Pour the hot sauce over the chicken; Toss well to coat evenly; Serve immediately, garnished with sesame seeds and chopped green onions if desired.

title: Sundubu Jjigae
description: Spicy Korean stew made with uncurdled tofu, vegetables, and seafood or meat, served boiling hot with rice.
instructions: Heat a Korean earthenware pot or heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat; Add sesame oil and sauté minced garlic until fragrant; Add the sliced pork belly or beef and cook until the meat changes color; Add sliced onions and chopped kimchi, stir-frying together for 2-3 minutes; Sprinkle in gochugaru and add gochujang; Mix well so the chili paste and flakes coat the meat and kimchi; Pour in the broth and bring the mixture to a boil; Once boiling, gently add chunks of soft tofu by spoonfuls, breaking some pieces apart but keeping others whole; Add soy sauce and sliced green chili; Let it simmer for about 10 minutes so the flavors meld; Taste and season with salt if necessary; If using, crack an egg into the stew carefully and let it cook for 2-3 minutes until the white is set but yolk remains runny; Finally, sprinkle chopped scallions on top before serving; Serve hot with steamed rice and side dishes.

title: Galbi
description: Korean BBQ dish of beef short ribs marinated in a sweet soy-based sauce, then grilled to perfection.
ingredients: Beef short ribs (flanken cut): 1 kg; Soy sauce: 1/2 cup; Brown sugar: 1/4 cup; Sesame oil: 2 tbsp; Garlic: 4 cloves, minced; Ginger: 1 tbsp, grated; Green onions: 3, chopped; Asian pear (or apple): 1/2, grated; Toasted sesame seeds: 1 tbsp; Black pepper: 1/2 tsp; Water: 1/4 cup
instructions: Prepare the short ribs by rinsing and patting dry; In a large bowl, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, chopped green onions, grated Asian pear, toasted sesame seeds, black pepper, and water; Mix the marinade thoroughly until sugar dissolves and ingredients are well blended; Place the ribs in the marinade, making sure each piece is well coated; Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight, to allow flavors to penetrate; Preheat grill or grill pan over medium-high heat; Remove ribs from marinade and shake off excess; Grill the ribs for about 4-5 minutes on each side, until nicely charred and cooked through but still tender; Let ribs rest for a few minutes before serving; Serve hot with steamed rice and side dishes like kimchi.

title: Gimbap
description: Korean dish similar to sushi rolls, made with rice, vegetables, and meats rolled in seaweed and sliced into bite-sized pieces.

title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
description: Comforting snack made by grilling bread slices with melted cheese in the middle, often served with tomato soup.
ingredients: Bread slices: 2;Butter: 2 tbsp (softened);Cheddar cheese slices: 2 (or grated cheese 1 cup);Optional: Tomato slices 2, Mustard 1 tsp, Black pepper a pinch
instructions: Spread butter evenly on one side of each bread slice;Place one slice buttered side down on a clean plate or cutting board;Layer the cheese slices evenly on the bread;Add tomato slices and sprinkle black pepper if using;Cover with the second bread slice, buttered side up;Preheat a non-stick skillet or frying pan over medium heat;Place the sandwich carefully on the skillet;Cook for about 3-4 minutes until the bread turns golden brown and crispy;Using a spatula, gently flip the sandwich to the other side;Cook for another 3-4 minutes until the second side is golden brown and the cheese has melted;Remove the sandwich from the pan and let it sit for 1 minute;Cut diagonally and serve warm.

title: Caesar Salad
description: Crisp salad of romaine lettuce, croutons, and Parmesan cheese tossed in Caesar dressing made with anchovies, egg, and lemon.
ingredients: Romaine lettuce hearts: 2, halved lengthwise;Olive oil: 3 tbsp;Salt: 1 tsp;Black pepper: ½ tsp;Garlic powder: ½ tsp;Parmesan cheese: ½ cup, grated;Caesar dressing: ½ cup;Croutons: 1 cup;Lemon wedges: for serving
instructions: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat, about 400°F (200°C);Brush the cut sides of the romaine lettuce halves generously with olive oil to prevent sticking and promote charring;Sprinkle salt, black pepper, and garlic powder evenly over the lettuce halves to season;Place the lettuce halves cut side down on the grill;Grill for about 2-3 minutes without moving them, allowing grill marks to form and the lettuce to slightly wilt;Carefully flip the lettuce halves and grill the other side for 1-2 minutes until slightly charred but still crisp;Remove the lettuce from the grill and place on a serving platter cut side up;Drizzle Caesar dressing evenly over the grilled lettuce;Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese generously on top of the dressed lettuce;Add croutons over the salad for crunch;Serve immediately with lemon wedges on the side to squeeze over for extra brightness

title: Meatball
description: Seasoned ground meat formed into balls and cooked by frying, baking, or simmering in sauce, often served with pasta.

title: Mac and Cheese
description: Creamy comfort food made from cooked macaroni pasta and a rich cheese sauce, often baked until bubbly and golden.
ingredients: Elbow Macaroni: 2 cups; Butter: 4 tbsp; All-purpose Flour: 3 tbsp; Milk (whole or 2%): 2.5 cups; Cheddar Cheese (shredded): 3 cups; Salt: 1 tsp; Black Pepper: 0.5 tsp; Mustard Powder (optional): 0.5 tsp; Paprika (optional): 0.25 tsp
instructions: Cook macaroni in boiling salted water until just tender but still firm, about 7-8 minutes; Drain macaroni and set aside. In a medium saucepan, melt butter over medium heat; Stir in flour and cook, whisking constantly for 1-2 minutes until mixture is lightly golden and bubbly; Slowly add milk while whisking continuously to avoid lumps. Cook the sauce, stirring often, until it thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 5-7 minutes; Remove from heat and add shredded cheddar cheese gradually, stirring until fully melted and smooth. Season cheese sauce with salt, black pepper, mustard powder, and paprika if using; Combine drained macaroni and cheese sauce in a large bowl, stirring gently to coat evenly. Serve immediately for creamy mac and cheese or transfer to a baking dish, top with extra cheese or breadcrumbs, and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20 minutes for a baked version.

title: Roast Chicken
description: Whole chicken seasoned and oven-roasted until crispy on the outside and juicy inside, often served with vegetables or potatoes.
ingredients: Whole chicken: 1.5 kg; Olive oil: 3 tbsp; Garlic cloves: 4, minced; Lemon: 1, halved; Fresh rosemary: 2 sprigs; Salt: 1 tbsp; Black pepper: 1 tsp; Paprika: 1 tsp; Onion: 1 large, quartered; Carrots: 2, cut into chunks; Potatoes: 3 medium, cut into chunks
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F); Rinse the chicken inside and out and pat dry with paper towels; Rub the chicken all over with olive oil, then season generously with salt, pepper, and paprika; Stuff the cavity with minced garlic, lemon halves, and rosemary sprigs; Place the quartered onion, carrots, and potatoes at the bottom of a roasting pan; Put the chicken on top of the vegetables, breast side up; Tie the legs together with kitchen twine and tuck the wing tips under the body; Roast the chicken in the oven for about 1 hour 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 75°C (165°F); Halfway through cooking, baste the chicken with the juices from the pan to keep it moist; Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before carving; Serve the chicken with the roasted vegetables on the side.

title: Meatloaf
description: Savory dish made from ground meat mixed with breadcrumbs and seasonings, shaped into a loaf and baked, often served with gravy or ketchup glaze.

title: Mashed Potatoes
description: Creamy side dish made by boiling potatoes, then mashing them with butter, milk, and seasoning until smooth.
ingredients: Potatoes: 1 kg, peeled and cut into chunks; Butter: 4 tbsp; Milk: 1/2 cup, warm; Salt: 1 tsp; Black pepper: 1/2 tsp; Garlic (optional): 2 cloves, minced
instructions: Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water; Add a pinch of salt to the water; Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; Cook potatoes until they are very tender when pierced with a fork, about 15-20 minutes; Drain the potatoes well in a colander; Return the potatoes to the pot and let them dry for 1-2 minutes on low heat to remove excess moisture; Add butter and minced garlic if using; Begin mashing the potatoes using a potato masher or fork; Gradually add warm milk while mashing to reach your desired creamy texture; Season with salt and black pepper; Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary; Serve warm.

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper, creating a creamy sauce without cream.
ingredients: Spaghetti: 400g; Pancetta or Guanciale: 150g, diced; Eggs: 3 large; Parmesan cheese: 100g, finely grated; Garlic: 1 clove, peeled; Olive oil: 1 tbsp; Black pepper: freshly ground, to taste; Salt: for pasta water
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil; Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente according to package instructions, usually about 8-10 minutes; While the pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat; Add the garlic clove and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant, then remove the garlic; Add the diced pancetta or guanciale to the pan; Cook, stirring occasionally, until the meat is crisp and golden, about 5-7 minutes; In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper; When the pasta is done, reserve about a cup of the pasta cooking water and then drain the spaghetti; Quickly add the hot pasta to the pan with the cooked pancetta; Remove the pan from heat to avoid scrambling the eggs; Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta; Toss vigorously and continuously to create a creamy sauce, adding reserved pasta water little by little to reach desired consistency; Serve immediately with extra Parmesan and black pepper on top.

title: Fish and Chips
description: British classic of battered and fried fish served with thick-cut fries, often accompanied by tartar sauce and mushy peas.

title: Quiche
description: Savory French tart made with a flaky pastry crust filled with a creamy egg custard, cheese, vegetables, or meat.
ingredients: Pie crust (store-bought or homemade): 1; Eggs: 4 large; Heavy cream or whole milk: 1 cup; Shredded cheese (Gruyère, cheddar, or Swiss): 1 cup; Cooked bacon or ham (optional): 1/2 cup, chopped; Onion: 1 small, finely chopped; Salt: 1/2 tsp; Black pepper: 1/4 tsp; Nutmeg (optional): a pinch; Olive oil or butter: 1 tbsp; Fresh spinach or other veggies (optional): 1/2 cup, chopped
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C); Place the pie crust into a 9-inch tart or pie pan and prick the bottom lightly with a fork; Line the crust with parchment paper and fill with pie weights or dried beans; Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes until lightly golden; Remove parchment and weights and set crust aside; Heat olive oil or butter in a skillet over medium heat; Sauté the chopped onion until translucent, about 3-4 minutes; If using vegetables like spinach, add them now and cook until wilted; Let the filling cool slightly; In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, cream or milk, salt, pepper, and nutmeg until smooth; Stir in the shredded cheese and cooked bacon or ham if using; Spread the sautéed onions and veggies evenly over the baked crust; Pour the egg mixture carefully on top; Place the quiche in the oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the filling is set and slightly golden on top; Let the quiche cool for about 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Pad Thai
description: Thai stir-fried noodle dish made with rice noodles, shrimp or chicken, tofu, eggs, and peanuts in a tangy tamarind sauce.

title: Green Curry
description: Spicy Thai curry made with green curry paste, coconut milk, vegetables, and meat or tofu, served with jasmine rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over medium heat; add green curry paste and stir-fry gently for about 1-2 minutes until fragrant; Add about half of the coconut milk and stir to mix with the curry paste; Bring it to a gentle simmer and cook for 3-4 minutes until the oil begins to separate from the paste; Add chicken pieces and stir well to coat with the curry paste; Cook the chicken for 5 minutes until it starts to change color; Add the remaining coconut milk and water or broth; Stir and bring to a gentle boil; Add the quartered eggplants and kaffir lime leaves; Stir in fish sauce and palm sugar; Let the curry simmer for 10-12 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and eggplants are tender; Taste the curry and adjust seasoning by adding more fish sauce or sugar if needed; Turn off the heat and stir in the Thai basil leaves and sliced red chili; Serve hot, garnished with fresh coriander if desired.

title: Tom Yum Soup
description: Hot and sour Thai soup made with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chili, and shrimp or chicken in a clear broth.
instructions: Bring water or chicken stock to a boil in a pot; Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, birds eye chilies, and shallots to the boiling water; Let the broth simmer gently for 5-7 minutes to infuse all the flavors; Add the mushrooms and tomato wedges; Continue simmering for 3-4 minutes until the mushrooms are tender; Add the shrimp to the pot and cook for 2-3 minutes or until they turn pink and opaque; Season the soup with fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar; Stir well and taste to adjust the seasoningbalance sour, salty, and sweet as you prefer; If using, stir in the Thai chili paste for extra flavor and heat; Turn off the heat; Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro before serving; Serve hot with steamed rice or enjoy as is.

title: Mango Sticky Rice
description: Thai dessert of glutinous rice soaked in sweet coconut milk, served with ripe mango slices and sometimes sesame seeds.
instructions: Rinse the glutinous rice under cold water until the water runs clear; Soak the rice in water for at least 4 hours or overnight for best texture; Drain the rice and steam it in a bamboo steamer or a regular steamer lined with cheesecloth for about 20-25 minutes until tender; While the rice is steaming, combine coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan; Heat gently over low heat, stirring until sugar dissolves completely; Do not let the coconut milk boil; Once the rice is cooked, transfer it to a large bowl; Pour about 3/4 of the sweetened coconut milk over the hot rice; Stir gently to combine and let the rice absorb the coconut milk for 15-20 minutes; Peel the mangoes and slice them thinly; To serve, place a portion of the sticky rice on a plate; Arrange mango slices beside the rice; Drizzle the remaining coconut milk over the top; Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds or mung beans for added texture and garnish if desired; Serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Papaya Salad
description: Known as Som Tam is a spicy Thai salad made with shredded green papaya, tomatoes, peanuts, chili, and lime juice, often paired with sticky rice.
ingredients: Green papaya (shredded): 2 cups; Cherry tomatoes: 10, halved; Green beans: 6-8, cut into 1-inch pieces; Garlic cloves: 2; Thai birds eye chilies: 2-3 (adjust to taste); Palm sugar: 1 tbsp (or brown sugar); Fish sauce: 2 tbsp; Lime juice: 2 tbsp; Roasted peanuts: 2 tbsp, crushed; Dried shrimp (optional): 1 tbsp; Carrot (shredded): ½ cup
instructions: Peel the green papaya and carrot; shred them finely using a grater or a julienne peeler; Set aside in a large bowl; Pound garlic and chilies in a mortar and pestle until roughly crushed; Add palm sugar and continue pounding until it dissolves slightly; Stir in fish sauce and lime juice; Mix well to balance sweet, salty, sour, and spicy flavors; Add cherry tomatoes, green beans, dried shrimp (if using), and shredded papaya and carrot; Toss everything together thoroughly using a spoon and fork or your hands; Taste and adjust seasoning by adding more lime juice, fish sauce, or sugar if needed; Finally, sprinkle crushed roasted peanuts on top before serving; Serve immediately for the best fresh crunch and flavor.

title: Pandan Chicken
description: Thai dish where marinated chicken is wrapped in pandan leaves and deep-fried, giving it a fragrant aroma and juicy texture.
ingredients: Chicken thighs (boneless, skin-on): 1 kg; Pandan leaves: 20-25 pieces; Garlic: 5 cloves; Shallots: 3; Coriander powder: 1 tbsp; Turmeric powder: 1 tsp; White pepper powder: 1 tsp; Soy sauce: 2 tbsp; Oyster sauce: 1 tbsp; Sugar: 1 tsp; Salt: 1 tsp; Coconut milk: 100 ml; Cooking oil: 2 tbsp
instructions: Peel garlic and shallots; finely mince both;In a bowl, combine minced garlic, shallots, coriander powder, turmeric powder, white pepper, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, salt, and coconut milk; Stir well to make the marinade;Cut chicken into medium-sized pieces; add to the marinade; mix thoroughly so all pieces are coated;Cover the bowl; refrigerate and marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavor; Take one pandan leaf; place a marinated chicken piece on the leafs end; roll tightly and secure with a toothpick or kitchen twine; Repeat until all chicken pieces are wrapped;Heat cooking oil in a frying pan over medium heat; Carefully add the pandan-wrapped chicken; Fry for about 7-10 minutes on each side or until the chicken is cooked through and golden brown; Remove from oil and drain excess oil on paper towels; Serve hot with steamed rice or as a snack.

title: Thai Basil Chicken
description: Stir-fried Thai dish made with ground chicken, garlic, chili, and holy basil, served over rice with a fried egg.
ingredients: Chicken (minced or chopped): 500g; Garlic: 4 cloves, minced; Fresh Thai birds eye chilies: 3-5, sliced (adjust to taste); Onion: 1 small, sliced; Vegetable oil: 2 tbsp; Soy sauce: 2 tbsp; Fish sauce: 1 tbsp; Oyster sauce: 1 tbsp; Sugar: 1 tsp; Fresh Thai basil leaves: 1 cup; Cooked jasmine rice: to serve
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat; Add minced garlic and sliced chilies; stir-fry quickly until fragrant, about 30 seconds; Add sliced onion and cook until slightly softened, about 2 minutes; Add the minced chicken; break it apart with a spatula; stir-fry until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink, about 5 minutes; Add soy sauce, fish sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar; stir everything together well so the chicken is evenly coated with the sauce; Cook for another 2 minutes to allow the flavors to blend; Turn off the heat and immediately add the fresh basil leaves; stir gently until the basil is wilted and fragrant; Serve hot over steamed jasmine rice.

title: Pineapple Fried Rice
description: Thai-style fried rice dish stir-fried with pineapple chunks, vegetables, shrimp or chicken, and curry powder.
ingredients: Cooked Jasmine Rice (preferably day-old): 3 cups;Pineapple (fresh, diced): 1 cup;Shrimp or Chicken (optional, cooked): 200g;Eggs: 2, beaten;Carrot (diced): ½ cup;Green Peas: ½ cup;Cashew Nuts: ¼ cup;Garlic (minced): 3 cloves;Onion (chopped): 1 small;Spring Onion (sliced): 2 stalks;Soy Sauce: 2 tbsp;Fish Sauce: 1 tbsp;Curry Powder: 1 tsp;Salt: to taste;White Pepper: ¼ tsp;Oil: 2 tbsp
instructions:
Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat;Add cashew nuts and stir-fry until golden brown, then remove and set aside.
Add more oil if needed;Sauté chopped onion and minced garlic until fragrant.
Push the onion and garlic to the side;Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble until cooked through.
Add cooked shrimp or chicken if using;Stir-fry together for 2 minutes to heat through.
Add diced carrots and peas;Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes until vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Add the cold cooked rice;Break up any clumps with a spatula and stir well to combine with other ingredients.
Sprinkle in curry powder, soy sauce, fish sauce, salt, and white pepper;Mix thoroughly so the rice is evenly coated and colored.
Toss in diced pineapple and previously fried cashew nuts;Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, stirring gently to avoid mashing the pineapple.
Add sliced spring onions;Give a final stir and remove from heat.

title: Thai-style Grilled Beef with Dipping Sauce
description: (Nam Tok) features grilled beef slices tossed with herbs and spices, served with a tangy lime-chili dipping sauce.
ingredients: Beef Flank Steak: 500g;Soy Sauce: 2 tbsp;Oyster Sauce: 2 tbsp;Fish Sauce: 1 tbsp;Palm Sugar (or Brown Sugar): 1 tbsp;Ground Black Pepper: 1 tsp;Garlic: 3 cloves, minced;Coriander Root: 2 roots, finely chopped;Lime Juice: 2 tbsp;Chili Flakes: 1 tsp (adjust to taste);Shallots: 2, thinly sliced;Fresh Coriander Leaves: a handful, chopped;Sticky Rice (toasted and ground): 1 tbsp (optional, for sauce);Oil: 1 tbsp
instructions:
Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, palm sugar, ground black pepper, minced garlic, and chopped coriander root in a bowl;Add beef to the marinade and coat thoroughly;Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, preferably overnight
Preheat a grill pan or outdoor grill over medium-high heat;Brush beef with a little oil before grilling
Grill beef for about 3 to 4 minutes on each side for medium doneness, or longer if preferred;Let the beef rest for 10 minutes after grilling to retain its juices
While resting, prepare the dipping sauce by mixing lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar, chili flakes, sliced shallots, chopped coriander, and ground toasted rice in a bowl;Stir well until sugar dissolves and all ingredients are combined
Slice beef thinly against the grain before serving;Serve with dipping sauce and sticky rice or steamed vegetables on the side

title: Thai Fish Cakes
description: Savory patties made from minced fish, red curry paste, and herbs, fried until golden and served with a sweet chili dipping sauce.
ingredients: White fish fillet (e.g. cod or tilapia): 500g;Red curry paste: 2 tbsp;Fish sauce: 1 tbsp;Egg: 1;Green beans: 50g, finely sliced;Kaffir lime leaves: 4, finely shredded;Sugar: 1 tsp;Cornstarch: 1 tbsp;Oil: for frying
instructions: Cut the fish fillets into chunks and place them in a food processor;Add red curry paste, fish sauce, egg, sugar, and cornstarch to the processor;Blend the mixture until it becomes a smooth, sticky paste;Transfer the paste to a bowl and mix in the sliced green beans and shredded kaffir lime leaves using a spoon or your hands;Wet your hands to prevent sticking, then form the paste into small, flat patties about 2 inches wide;Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat until hot;Fry the fish cakes in batches, cooking each side for about 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown;Remove and drain on paper towels;Serve hot with sweet chili dipping sauce.

title: Ayam Penyet
description: Popular Indonesian dish featuring deep-fried chicken thats smashed to tenderize the meat, then served with spicy sambal, fresh cucumber, fried tofu, and tempeh. Originating from East Java, this dish is known for its crispy texture and bold, fiery flavors.
ingredients: Whole chicken or chicken pieces (about 1 kg); Turmeric powder: 1 tbsp; Garlic: 5 cloves; Shallots: 4; Salt: 1 tsp; Water: enough to boil chicken; Cooking oil: for frying;Red chilies: 6 to 8 (adjust to your spice level); Birds eye chilies: 2 (optional, for extra heat); Shallots: 3; Garlic: 3 cloves; Tomatoes: 1 medium; Salt: to taste; Sugar: 1 tsp; Lime juice: 1 tbsp; Cooking oil: 2 tbsp
instructions:
Prepare the chicken by cleaning it thoroughly; rub turmeric powder and salt all over the chicken; boil the chicken in enough water until fully cooked and tender, about 25-30 minutes; drain and let it cool slightly.
While the chicken is boiling, prepare the sambal by roughly chopping the red chilies, birds eye chilies, shallots, garlic, and tomato.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté the chopped shallots and garlic until fragrant and golden; add the chilies and tomato and cook until soft; remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Grind or blend the cooked chili mixture using a mortar and pestle or blender, adding salt and sugar; adjust seasoning to taste; stir in lime juice for freshness.
After the chicken is cool enough to handle, deep-fry it in hot oil until the skin is crispy and golden brown; remove and drain on paper towels.
Serve the fried chicken hot, smashed lightly with a pestle or the back of a spoon to tenderize; accompany with fresh cucumber slices, fried tofu, rice, and the prepared sambal on the side.

title: Ayam Masak Ungkep
description: Javanese-style braised chicken dish simmered in a rich blend of ground spices including coriander, garlic, turmeric, and galangal. The chicken is slow-cooked until tender, allowing the spices to fully infuse, and is often fried briefly before serving.
ingredients: Chicken (cut into medium pieces): 1kg;Shallots: 6 cloves;Garlic: 5 cloves;Coriander seeds: 1 tbsp;Cumin seeds: 1 tsp;Fennel seeds: 1 tsp;Turmeric powder: 1 tsp;Galangal: 1 inch;Ginger: 1 inch;Bay leaves: 2;Lemongrass (bruised): 1 stalk;Water: 400ml;Salt: to taste;Sugar: 1 tsp;Oil: 2 tbsp
instructions: Toast coriander, cumin, and fennel seeds in a dry pan until fragrant, then grind into powder;Blend shallots, garlic, ginger, galangal, and the ground spices into a smooth paste;Heat oil in a pan and sauté the blended paste until fragrant and the oil separates from the paste;Add chicken pieces and stir to coat evenly with the spices;Add turmeric powder, bay leaves, lemongrass, salt, and sugar, then stir to combine;Pour in water, cover the pan, and simmer over low heat for 30 to 40 minutes until the chicken is tender and the gravy thickens;Uncover and increase heat to medium if you want to reduce the sauce further or lightly brown the chicken before serving

title: Ayam Gepuk
description: Central Javanese fried chicken dish where the boiled chicken is smashed, then topped with hot chili sambal thats sautéed in oil. It is known for its soft, juicy interior, crispy edges, and intensely spicy sambal that coats every bite.
ingredients: Chicken (whole or cut): 1kg;Water: enough to boil chicken;Salt: 1 tsp;Turmeric powder: 1 tsp;Cooking oil: for frying;Red chilies (big): 10 pcs;Birds eye chilies: 10 pcs;Garlic: 6 cloves;Shallots: 6 pcs;Salt: to taste;Sugar: 1 tsp;Chicken broth: 4 tbsp;Cooking oil: 3 tbsp

title: Soto Ayam
description: Comforting Indonesian chicken soup made with turmeric-spiced broth, shredded chicken, vermicelli, boiled egg, and crispy shallots. Often enjoyed with rice or compressed rice cakes, It is a beloved street food known for its warmth and depth of flavor.
ingredients: Chicken: 1 whole (about 1.2 kg), cut into pieces;Water: 2 liters;Lemongrass: 2 stalks, smashed;Kaffir Lime Leaves: 4;Bay Leaves: 2;Galangal: 1 inch, smashed;Turmeric Powder: 1 tsp;Coriander Powder: 2 tsp;Cumin Powder: 1 tsp;Salt: to taste;Oil: 3 tbsp;Shallots: 6;Garlic: 4 cloves;Candlenuts: 3 (or substitute with macadamia);Ginger: 1 inch;Fresh Turmeric (or 1 tsp powder): 1 inch;Vermicelli noodles: 100g, soaked and boiled;Boiled eggs: 2, halved;Bean sprouts: 1 cup, blanched;Fried shallots: 3 tbsp;Spring onions: 2 stalks, sliced;Lime wedges: 2;Sambal: optional
instructions: Blend shallots, garlic, candlenuts, ginger, and turmeric into a smooth paste;Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat and sauté the spice paste until fragrant, about 4 to 5 minutes. Stir continuously to avoid burning;Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, bay leaves, and galangal. Continue sautéing for another 2 minutes until the herbs are aromatic;Add chicken pieces into the pot. Stir well to coat them with the spices. Let the chicken brown slightly for 5 to 7 minutes;Pour in water and bring to a boil. Skim off any foam or impurities that rise to the surface to keep the broth clear;Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Stir and reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 45 to 60 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and tender;Remove the chicken from the pot. Let it cool slightly, then shred the meat into bite-sized pieces and discard the bones;Strain the broth if you want it clear. Return the shredded chicken to the pot and keep warm over low heat;To serve, place some vermicelli noodles, bean sprouts, and shredded chicken in a bowl. Pour hot broth over;Top with boiled egg halves, fried shallots, and spring onions. Squeeze lime juice over before eating. Add sambal if you like it spicy

title: Bakso
description: Indonesian meatball soup featuring bouncy beef or chicken meatballs served in a savory broth with noodles, tofu, and vegetables. Often sold by street vendors, bakso is a hearty and affordable comfort food enjoyed across the country.
ingredients: Ground Beef: 500g;Tapioca Flour: 100g;Garlic: 4 cloves, minced;White Pepper: 1 tsp;Salt: 2 tsp;Ice Cubes: 6 pieces;Cold Water: 100ml;Egg: 1;Beef Bones: 500g (for broth);Shallots: 4, sliced;Garlic: 3 cloves, smashed;Leek: 1 stalk, sliced;Water: 2 liters;Salt: to taste;Noodles: as needed;Fried Shallots: for garnish;Celery: chopped, for garnish;Soy Sauce: to taste;Chili Sauce: to taste
instructions:
Place ground beef, tapioca flour, garlic, white pepper, salt, egg, and ice cubes into a food processor;Blend until smooth and sticky;Add cold water little by little if mixture is too dry;Boil water in a large pot until it simmers;Wet your hands, shape the beef mixture into balls using your palms or a spoon;Drop the meatballs gently into the simmering water;Wait until the meatballs float, then cook for another 3 to 5 minutes;Remove and set aside the meatballs

In a separate pot, prepare the broth;Boil 2 liters of water and add beef bones;Skim the surface to remove scum;Add shallots, smashed garlic, leek, and salt;Simmer for 1 to 2 hours until flavorful;Strain the broth and keep it warm

To serve, place noodles in a bowl and add several meatballs;Ladle hot broth over them;Garnish with fried shallots and chopped celery;Serve with soy sauce and chili sauce on the side for extra flavor

title: Sate Madura
description: Grilled meat skewer dish from Madura Island, typically made with chicken or beef marinated in spices and served with a rich, sweet-spicy peanut sauce. It is often paired with rice cakes (lontong) and is a staple in Indonesian street food culture.
