ingredients: Chicken thighs (boneless, skinless): 1 kg, cut into small cubes;Sweet soy sauce (kecap manis): 6 tbsp;Garlic: 5 cloves, minced;Shallots: 6, finely chopped;Candlenuts: 3, toasted and crushed;Coriander powder: 1 tsp;Palm sugar (or brown sugar): 1 tbsp, grated;Salt: 1 tsp;Cooking oil: 2 tbsp;Skewers: 15 to 20, soaked in water;Roasted peanuts: 150 g, ground;Garlic: 3 cloves;Red chilies: 3, seeded (optional for less heat);Sweet soy sauce: 3 tbsp;Tamarind paste: 1 tsp;Salt: 1/2 tsp;Sugar: 1 tsp;Water: 200 ml;Cooking oil: 1 tbsp
instructions:
Make the marinade by blending garlic, shallots, candlenuts, coriander powder, palm sugar, salt, and oil into a paste;Mix the paste with sweet soy sauce in a bowl;Add chicken pieces and coat evenly;Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight

Thread marinated chicken onto skewers;Preheat grill or charcoal fire to medium heat;Grill skewers while brushing occasionally with leftover marinade mixed with a little oil;Turn skewers frequently;Cook until chicken is browned and cooked through

To make peanut sauce, blend garlic, red chilies, and peanuts until smooth;Heat oil in a pan;Sauté blended mixture until fragrant;Add water, sweet soy sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and salt;Stir and simmer until sauce thickens

Serve satay hot with a generous spoonful of peanut sauce;Optionally, serve with rice cakes (lontong) and sliced shallots on the side

title: Pecel Lele
description: Traditional East Javanese meal consisting of deep-fried catfish served with sambal, fresh vegetables, and rice. Simple yet flavorful, the crispy fish and spicy chili paste make it a beloved and affordable dish across Indonesia.
ingredients: Catfish (Lele): 4 whole, cleaned;Salt: 1 tsp;Lime: 1, juiced;Oil: for deep frying;Red chilies: 10 pcs;Birds eye chilies: 5 pcs;Tomatoes: 2 medium, chopped;Shallots: 5 pcs;Garlic: 3 cloves;Tamarind paste: 1 tsp;Salt: 1 tsp;Sugar: 1 tsp;Oil: 2 tbsp;Steamed rice: as needed;Fresh basil leaves: a handful;Cucumber: 1, sliced;Fried tofu or tempeh: as preferred
instructions:
Rub catfish with lime juice and salt;Let it sit for 15 minutes to remove the fishy smell;Rinse under cold water and pat dry.
Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat;Fry catfish until golden brown and crispy on both sides;Drain on paper towels.
Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a small pan;Sauté shallots, garlic, chilies, and tomatoes until softened and slightly charred;Remove from heat.
Transfer sautéed ingredients to a mortar or food processor;Add tamarind paste, salt, and sugar;Grind or blend into a coarse sambal paste.
Serve fried catfish with sambal on the side or on top;Add steamed rice, fresh basil, cucumber slices, and fried tofu or tempeh to complete the dish.

title: Gado Gado
description: Mixed vegetable salad served with boiled egg, tofu, tempeh, and lontong, all topped with a creamy peanut sauce. This hearty dish is both nutritious and flavorful, offering a perfect balance of sweetness, spice, and crunch.
ingredients: Boiled Potatoes: 2, medium-sized, peeled and cubed;Blanched Cabbage: 1 cup, shredded;Blanched Long Beans: 1 cup, cut into 2-inch lengths;Bean Sprouts: 1 cup, blanched;Cucumber: 1, sliced;Tofu: 200g, fried and cubed;Tempeh: 200g, fried and sliced;Hard-Boiled Eggs: 2, halved;Lontong (rice cakes): 1 cup, sliced;Fried Shallots: 2 tbsp;Prawn Crackers: as desired;Peanuts: 200g, roasted;Garlic: 2 cloves;Red Chilies: 2 (adjust to taste);Palm Sugar: 1 tbsp (or brown sugar);Tamarind Paste: 1 tsp;Salt: to taste;Water: 1 cup;Sweet Soy Sauce (Kecap Manis): 2 tbsp;Cooking Oil: 1 tbsp
instructions:
Blend roasted peanuts, garlic, red chilies, palm sugar, tamarind paste, and salt until smooth;Add water gradually while blending until you reach a thick but pourable consistency.

Heat oil in a saucepan;Pour the blended mixture into the pan and cook over medium heat;Stir continuously to prevent burning.

Add sweet soy sauce;Continue to cook the sauce for 5 to 7 minutes until it thickens and becomes aromatic;Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.

Arrange boiled potatoes, blanched cabbage, long beans, bean sprouts, cucumber, tofu, tempeh, and rice cakes on a large serving plate;Top with halved hard-boiled eggs.

Pour generous amounts of peanut sauce over the salad;Sprinkle with fried shallots and serve with prawn crackers on the side.

title: Mie Aceh
description: Spicy noodle dish from Aceh, made with thick yellow noodles stir-fried or served in broth with beef, seafood, or goat meat. Rich in spices like cardamom and star anise, It is known for its bold, curry-like flavors and vibrant color.
